attributes.action: Do not change the dates of GCSE exams so students can observe Ramadan
attributes.additional_details: Moving the dates forward gives students less time to prepare for the most important test of their life.Regardless of the religion it is inconceivable that the many suffer for the "few." Religion shouldn't be involved in your future especially when its not your religion.
attributes.background: The dates for tests in the U.K have been moved forward so a minority of fasting Muslim students are not at a disadvantage. Thisd means that instead of 30% of the countries students being at a disadvantage the whole 100% are.

rejection.details:
Decisions about the dates of exams are taken by exam boards, not by the UK Government or Parliament. 

You may be interested in this recent statement made by the Joint Council for Qualifications, which is a membership organisation comprising the seven largest providers of qualifications in the UK:

http://www.jcq.org.uk/media-centre/news-releases/jcq-statement---exam-timetables
